ygData.subject: Re: Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
ygData.msgSnippet: The letter that I posted was not my writing, I read it from the EQ Lizer site.  I am also trying to get into touch with the writter of the letter to enlist his
ygData.messageBody:
The letter that I posted was not my writing, I read it from the EQ'Lizer
site. I am also trying to get into touch with the writter of the letter to
enlist his help. I have only almost attained level 31. But in the time I
have played, and having interaction with some other players (warriors and
monk) I am a firm believer in the warrior is/will be not worth having in a
group of high level players. Sure, he will always be able to tank, but
other than that, he will have no participation in a group. The proverbial
punching bag. Every skill we have is shared with a hybrid group. We get
nothing special at all. I do not want to be a cry baby, but this just seems
unfair to me. Something to make the warrior stand out as the class that you
need to have when in physical combat would be nice. I mean isnt that the
true calling of a warrior? Many of the ideas you have submitted to me so
far are really good. And I will put together a complete list of everything
we come up with. I will not send this to verant until we get enough to make
a good selection from. Then when I send it to them, it will be "this is
some of the options that we have come up with... what do you think" type
attitude. They should listen to us, they listen to everyone else. Why
alienate one class when they are bending over backwards for others?

Dyvim Kincaid
Stormriders of Cazic Thule

> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 1:06 PM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
>
>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> What Verant needs to do and I think trys to do is provide
> distinction among
> the classes without having any one class over-shadow all of the others.
> �
> Although my experience is minimal compared to your (my level 13 and your
> level 43 (44?)), I would support your petition to ensure that the warrior
> class is made to be distictive and the one true melee combat class.� If
> Verant has erred somewhere by allowing all of the "add-on" things of the
> hybrid classes to cause these classes to compete with or go
> further than the
> warriors in the higher levels, then they need to do something to fix it.
> �
> I'd hate to spend all my time getting to where you are and end up feeling
> like it was just not worth it.
> �
> Snyak
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Wofford [mailto:James.Wofford@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 1:28 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
>
>
> I am not actually board with my character, just tired of waiting for the
> goodies to come when they are actually no where to be found.� They will
> never get to us, and we are outweighed even in a group setting by other
> melee classes.
> �
> I am not so concerned about the magic using/healing/gating part
> of this as I
> am the fact that the masters of physical combat (warriors) are
> anything but
> that.� Healing never has been IMO a part of what a warrior can do.� But a
> warrior is supposed to be the master or armed combat.� When we cap out at
> skill level 200 and others can go beyond that as well as do more
> damage than
> us warrior, something is definitely wrong.� I think we should start a
> pettition to verant to try to even things out a bit more.� The suggestions
> in this post on EQ`Lizer for modifying the Warrior class are well thought
> and not too much to ask.�
> �
> If anyone else is at all interested in starting a pettition, I will get
> things going.� Just let me know and I can get things rolling on
> it....� Even
> if you dont respond to me on this, I will get things going anyways.�
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Elena Glenn [ mailto:braveheart@...
> <mailto:braveheart@...> ]
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 11:27 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <mailto:warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
>
>
> James....I also am getting a little bored with my level 19 Barbarian
> Warrior.� One of the reasons, I guess, that I started the Bard.�
> I do think
> that Verant has overlooked us slightly.� When I played Realm, the
> warrior on
> there could buy mana and cast spells.� Agreed, they didn't work as well as
> the mages did, but we still could have the basics.� I would like to see
> Verant come up with another plan.� Perhaps some sort of magic skill, so at
> the very least, we could gate and cast healing on ourselves.�
> �
> Leri
>
>
